item.title: Wayne add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "I celebrate myself, and sing myself, / And what I assume you shall assume, / For every atom belonging to me as good belongs to you." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Wayne add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "All of old. Nothing else ever. Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try again. Fail again. Fail better." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Wayne add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Begin at the beginning," the King said, very gravely, "and go on till you come to the end: then stop." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Wayne add a quote by Elizabeth Edwards
item.description: "Resilience is accepting your new reality, even if it's less good than the one you had before. You can fight it, you can do nothing but scream about what you've lost, or you can accept that and try to put together something that's good." -- Elizabeth Edwards

item.title: Wayne add a quote by Romain Rolland
item.description: "Be reverent before the dawning day. Do not think of what will be in a year, or in ten years. Think of to-day." -- Romain Rolland

item.title: Wayne add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Growing up is losing some illusions, in order to acquire others." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Wayne add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "The mark of the immature man is that he wants to die nobly for a cause, while the mark of the mature man is that he wants to live humbly for one." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Wayne add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "Most people don't grow up. Most people age. They find parking spaces, honor their credit cards, get married, have children, and call that maturity. What that is, is aging." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Wayne add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Some day you will be old enough to start reading fairy tales again." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Wayne add a quote by Judy Blume
item.description: "My only advice is to stay aware, listen carefully, and yell for help if you need it." -- Judy Blume

item.title: Wayne add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Who in the world am I? Ah, that's the great puzzle." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Wayne add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "But I don’t want to go among mad people," Alice remarked. "Oh, you can’t help that," said the Cat: "we’re all mad here. I’m mad. You’re mad." "How do you know I’m mad?" said Alice. "You must be," said the Cat, or you wouldn’t have come here." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Wayne add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "I can't go back to yesterday because I was a different person then." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Wayne add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "I know who I WAS when I got up this morning, but I think I must have been changed several times since then" -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Wayne add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Curiouser and curiouser." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Wayne add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Everything is funny, if you can laugh at it." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Wayne add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "But better to get hurt by the truth than comforted with a lie." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Wayne add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "We are all born mad. Some remain so." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Wayne add a quote by Mary Shelley
item.description: "Beware; for I am fearless, and therefore powerful." -- Mary Shelley

item.title: Wayne add a quote by William Carlos Williams
item.description:
"<b>This is Just to Say </b>
I have eaten the plums that were in the icebox
and which you were probably saving for breakfast
Forgive me they were delicious so sweet and so cold" -- William Carlos Williams

item.title: Wayne add a quote by Rudyard Kipling
item.description: "Words are, of course, the most powerful drug used by mankind." -- Rudyard Kipling

item.title: Wayne add a quote by Rudyard Kipling
Wayne add a quote by Rudyard Kipling
item.description: "If you can keep your head when all about you Are losing theirs and blaming it on you, If you can trust yourself when all men doubt you, But make allowance for their doubting too;!" -- Rudyard Kipling
